reviews.review_msg: He is willing to scale the difficulty of the course to match student feedback. His tests were scaled to include less theory in exams 2 and 3. His slides often included real life applications and motivates the problem before teaching it, but his tendency to do so may be from the fact that he is the VP of one of the biggest Chinese companies.

Wonderful prof. The tests and homework are designed really well so that they make you work for understanding the concepts. The slides may be on the more difficult/confusing side, and might contain unnecessary entrepreneurial information but otherwise, you get a lot from taking 459. Also, Dr. Pei is a very knowledgeable, passionate and kind person.

Lectures are content heavy and lengthy/wordy. Course itself really wasn't too difficult especially if you have some data science background. If you're completely new then this 400-level class is gonna be harder for you. Very unclear and arbitrary marking practices though. Not always open to correct answers if they differ from his explanation.

Very nice professor but his class is very hard for no reason. I am sure if I took this class with anybody else I would be doing much better. His exams are lengthy and full of proofs, and his lectures are confusing. I don't get the point of teaching data mining using proofs when you can write the algorithm using one line of code. Avoid at all costs.

Even though he is such a nice person, his class is extremely difficult. I had the worst experience in this class. His lectures are just so confusing. It is extremely hard to understand. His explanations on a lot of topics are extremely vague. He makes lengthy exam so that students cannot finish in time (and he says it in his slides).

Jian is very interested in the area of data mining and it shows. He is very passionate in his lectures and conveys the material well. English is an issue for him, very thick accent and sometimes he is hard to understand. Other than that very good. Would highly recommend for this class.
Data mining is Martin's bread and butter. Must take course when he is teaching it.
Good experience
He knows his stuff and it's interesting to learn from the guy who invented DBSCAN. The average for all the midterms were < 50% though...

Dr. Ester isn't charismatic, but he is caring and knowledgeable.

For a world-renowned Computer Scientist, I was surprised to hear him asking how we mere undergrads were doing every lecture.

The course requires intellectual interest. If not interested in Data Mining, you'll fall asleep.

Otherwise, you'll be learning from the best.

Always goes overtime and short 5 min breaks. Do not take with class immediately after, unless in same room.
Many technical slides, and does not cover in depth. I learned nearly nothing during lectures.
Many technical difficulties. Many computer issues, which distracts learning.
Brutal marking on short answer on midterms.

Extremely time consuming with multiple midterms, group project and multiple assignments. Each of the assignments and group project milestones take at least a few days to finish and are grueling to finish or even get working (first "easy"ssignment code took over 300 lines of code for me and 5 days of working it on it all day) unreal expectations

Dr. Ester authored some of the seminal papers in Data Mining in the past, so he's def very knowledgeable. The class is not the most engaging however, sometimes we're just given algorithms without any theoretical motivation. Open-book quiz and final project are extremely easy - overall a grade booster as an online class.

Lectures are hard to follow for the same reasons from post below me. A lot of homework, 1 paper assignment + 1 programming assignment alternating every week for a total of 5 each. Both are hard so start early and be ready to learn R very quickly. Midterm/Final 45% sim to paper assignments. Don't be shy to ask questions! Email/office hours are key.

I believe he knows well about data mining and he treats students with respect. But he can not teach. He does not know how to explain a topic to a novice. He tries to teach too much advanced algorithms and theories without laying a solid foundation. If the class was taught by anyone else, I would have learned so much more and better. Avoid Dr. Ester

Martin is a renowned scholar in Data mining. I think taking 459 from him is one of the best ways to fully utilize the CS education at SFU. Although his lectures are a little bit boring, and there are too many assignments, you can learn a lot of things from this course. "HE KNOWS THE SUBJECT VERY WELL" This is all I can say here.

He is a very knowledgeable professor from the School of Computing Science and he is always willing to help students to get thru the toughest part of the course. CMPT 459 (Data Mining) is a hot topic in the tech. industry right now and Dr. Ester is one of the best prof. you should take this course with.
No Comments
He has no sense of how to grade.
Awesome prof! I learned about research and graph mining softwares. Prof vora is so kind and caring he answered all questions and encouraged to discuss during lectures.
Awesome graduate level course for undergrads for discussion of graph mining papers. Learnt so many new things. I will request to work in Keval's lab.
